main event: On April 24, 1949, five observers near Arrey, New Mexico saw a rapidly moving, whitish spherical object while following a released balloon with a theodolite.
interesting points: The object was initially mistaken for the released balloon,The observed object was moving at an estimated speed of 5Â°/sec.,The observers noted the object was whitish and ellipsoidal,There were no observable trails or noise made by the object,An estimation placed the object's altitude around 300,000 feet, suggesting it was not a balloon.
sighted object: a rapidly moving whitish spherical object
witness description: Navy enlisted men from White Sands Proving Ground and others involved in balloon observations
